Package org.forgerock.openidm.repo.jdbc.impl

Class MappedTableHandler

java.lang.Object
org.forgerock.openidm.repo.jdbc.impl.MappedTableHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
TableHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
MSSQLMappedTableHandler, OracleMappedTableHandler, PostgreSQLMappedTableHandler
public class MappedTableHandler extends Object implements TableHandler
Handling of tables in a generic (not object specific) layout

    • initializeQueries

    • read

      public org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceResponse read(String fullId, String type, String localId, Connection connection) throws org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException, SQLException, org.forgerock.json.resource.InternalServerErrorException
      Description copied from interface: TableHandler
      Gets an object from the repository by identifier. The returned object is not validated against the current schema and may need processing to conform to an updated schema.

      The object will contain metadata properties, including object identifier _id, and object version _rev to enable optimistic concurrency

      Specified by:
      read in interface TableHandler
      Parameters:
      fullId - the qualified identifier of the object to retrieve from the object set.
      type - is the qualifier of the object to retrieve
      localId - the identifier without the qualifier of the object to retrieve
      Returns:
      the requested object.
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
      SQLException - if a DB failure was reported
      org.forgerock.json.resource.InternalServerErrorException - if the operation failed because of a (possibly transient) failure
      See Also:
      • TableHandler.read(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.sql.Connection)

    • create

      public void create(String fullId, String type, String localId, Map<String,Object> obj, Connection connection) throws SQLException, IOException
      Description copied from interface: TableHandler
      Creates a new object in the object set.

      This method sets the _id property to the assigned identifier for the object, and the _rev property to the revised object version (For optimistic concurrency)

      Specified by:
      create in interface TableHandler
      Parameters:
      fullId - the client-generated identifier to use, or null if server-generated identifier is requested.
      obj - the contents of the object to create in the object set.
      Throws:
      SQLException
      org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified id could not be resolved.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object or object set is forbidden.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.PreconditionFailedException - if an object with the same ID already exists.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.InternalServerErrorException - if the operation failed because of a (possibly transient) failure
      IOException
      See Also:
      • TableHandler.create(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.util.Map, java.sql.Connection)

    • create

      protected void create(String fullId, String type, String localId, Map<String,Object> obj, Connection connection, PreparedStatement createStatement, boolean batchCreate) throws SQLException, IOException
      Adds the option to batch more than one create statement
      Parameters:
      batchCreate - if true just adds create to batched statements, does not execute. false the statement is executed directly
      Throws:
      SQLException
      IOException
      See Also:
      • for the other parameters

    • update

      public void update(String fullId, String type, String localId, String rev, Map<String,Object> obj, Connection connection) throws SQLException, IOException, org.forgerock.json.resource.PreconditionFailedException, org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException, org.forgerock.json.resource.InternalServerErrorException
      Description copied from interface: TableHandler
      Updates the specified object in the object set.

      This implementation requires MVCC and hence enforces that clients state what revision they expect to be updating If successful, this method updates metadata properties within the passed object, including: a new _rev value for the revised object's version

      Specified by:
      update in interface TableHandler
      Parameters:
      fullId - the identifier of the object to be put, or null to request a generated identifier.
      rev - the version of the object to update; or null if not provided.
      obj - the contents of the object to put in the object set.
      Throws:
      SQLException
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ConflictException - if version is required but is null.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object is forbidden.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.PreconditionFailedException - if version did not match the existing object in the set.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the passed identifier is invalid
      org.forgerock.json.resource.InternalServerErrorException - if the operation failed because of a (possibly transient) failure
      IOException
      See Also:
      • TableHandler.update(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.util.Map, java.sql.Connection)

      Description copied from interface: TableHandler
      Deletes the specified object from the object set.
      Specified by:
      delete in interface TableHandler
      Parameters:
      fullId - the identifier of the object to be deleted.
      rev - the version of the object to delete or null if not provided.
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.PreconditionFailedException - if version did not match the existing object in the set.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.InternalServerErrorException - if the operation failed because of a (possibly transient) failure
      org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.

    • query

      public List<Map<String,Object>> query(String type, Map<String,Object> params, Connection connection) throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
      Description copied from interface: TableHandler
      Performs the query on the specified object and returns the associated results.

      Queries are parametric; a set of named parameters is provided as the query criteria. The query result is a JSON object structure composed of basic Java types. The returned map is structured as follow: - The top level map contains meta-data about the query, plus an entry with the actual result records. - The QueryConstants defines the map keys, including the result records (QUERY_RESULT)

      Specified by:
      query in interface TableHandler
      Parameters:
      type - identifies the object to query.
      params - the parameters of the query to perform.
      Returns:
      the query results, which includes meta-data and the result records in JSON object structure format.
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the specified params contain invalid arguments, e.g. a query id that is not configured, a query expression that is invalid, or missing query substitution tokens.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object or specified query is forbidden.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.InternalServerErrorException - if the operation failed because of a (possibly transient) failure
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
      See Also:
      • TableHandler.delete(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.sql.Connection)

    • command

      public Integer command(String type, Map<String,Object> params, Connection connection) throws SQLException, org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
      Description copied from interface: TableHandler
      Performs the command on the specified target and returns the number of affected objects

      Commands are parametric; a set of named parameters is provided as the query criteria. The command returns the number of records altered/updated/deleted.

      Specified by:
      command in interface TableHandler
      Parameters:
      type - identifies the object to query.
      params - the parameters of the query to perform.
      Returns:
      the number of records affected.
      Throws:
      SQLException
      org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the specified params contain invalid arguments, e.g. a query id that is not configured, a query expression that is invalid, or missing query substitution tokens.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object or specified query is forbidden.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.InternalServerErrorException - if the operation failed because of a (possibly transient) failure
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException

      public boolean isErrorType(SQLException ex, ErrorType errorType)
      Description copied from interface: TableHandler

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      ex - The exception thrown by the database
      errorType - the error type to test against
      Returns:
